alert.note: Alert for Monterey (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 10 at 4:47PM PST until December 10 at 6:30PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Francisco has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The Colorado burn area in... Northwestern Monterey County in central California... * Until 630 PM PST. * At 447 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain over the Colorado Burn Area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 0.9 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn area will result in debris flow moving through the Colorado burn area. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain in and around the Colorado Burn Area. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Colorado Burn Area. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... areas along Hwy 1 FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-0.9 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Colorado Burn Area. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
